results.title: Antarctica
results.brief_description: New Zealand’s proximity to Antarctica has led to an active involvement in its scientific exploration since the late 50s. Antarctica has seen two historical periods- the early age of exploration and the age of scientific exploration. With the scarcity of natural resources will the next age be that of exploitation

results.title: Antarctic winter
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Robert Horne and David Parer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Emperor and Adelia penguins are shown in their natural habitat during the Antarctic winter playing the “evolutionary game” of adaptation and survival. The penguins are shown travelling to the rookeries, preparing nesting sites, in courtship and mating, breeding, feeding and caring for their chicks.

results.title: Antarctic whalehunt
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Modern Age”.
Part of the series “This Modern Age”, this film deals with modern methods of hunting and killing whales, the case for more humane methods, and the possible effects of indiscriminate depletion of the number of whales in the Antarctic.

results.brief_description:

results.title: Antarctic man. No. 2. This is not a place for humans
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and David Parer
results.brief_description: This is the second part of a two-part documentary recording the International Biomedical Expedition to the Antarctic. The purpose of the expedition was to measure the effects of the Antarctic environment on both the human body and mind, including the extreme cold climate, isolation and separation from family and home. Shows the physiological and psychological pressures and physical limits the Expedition set for themselves. Some coped, some didn’t - but the ordeal had a lasting effect on all of them. Narrated by W. Francis Bell.
results.title_for_label: Antarctic man. No. 2. This is not a place for humans

results.title: Antarctic man. No. 1. Fears do not kill you
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit, Australia. Antarctic Division and David Parer
results.brief_description: This is a two-part documentary about an international group of scientists who organised an expedition to the Antarctic. For three months they measured the stresses of Antarctic life on body and mind. Part 1 deals with the laboratory phase of the expedition as the scientists subject themselves to some gruelling experiments to discover the limits of their endurance. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Antarctic crossing
results.creator_credit: World Wide Pictures, James Carr and George Lowe
results.brief_description: An account of the establishment and execution of the 1957-58 Commonwealth Trans-Antarctic Expedition under Sir Vivian Fuchs, with support by the New Zealand party under Sir Edmund Hillary. Includes excerpts from original films of the Scott and Shackleton Expedition by courtesy of the British Film Institute Archives.

results.title: Antarctic adventure
results.brief_description: A record of the New Zealand Expedition to Antarctica during the International Geophysical Year. Shows the party led by Sir Edmund Hillary setting out in the N.Z. Navy Vessel “Endeavour”. Follows their progress through the Antarctic Ocean to Ross Island, and the establishment of Antarctic bases in cooperation with the American party.
results.description: A record of the New Zealand Expedition to Antarctica during the International Geophysical Year. Shows the party led by Sir Edmund Hillary setting out in the N.Z. Navy Vessel “Endeavour”. Follows their progress through the Antarctic Ocean to Ross Island, and the establishment of Antarctic bases in cooperation with the American party.

results.title: Antamosi
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Ana Kokkinos
results.brief_description: Memories, betrayals and secrets emerge from the past when Katina’s mother comes from Greece to visit the family. As the truth about the family’s war-time involvement is revealed, the bitter embrace between mother and daughter is observed by Katina’s own daughter Sophia who must play her own role in this moving drama of estrangement.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Ana Kokkinos
